item.title: Solving very simple substitution ciphers algorithmically
item.description:
Description

A historical text may now be unreadable, because its language is unknown, or its script forgotten (or both), or because it was deliberately enciphered. Deciphering needs two steps: Identify the language, then map the unknown script to a familiar one. Iâ€™ll present an algorithm to solve a cartoon version of this problem, where the language is known, and the cipher is alphabet rearrangement.
